00034   // Global Functions
00035   // ================
00036   template <typename NT>
00037   inline NT mb_sqr (NT r) {return r*r;}
00038 
00039   // Functors
00040   // ========
00041 
00042   // functor to map a point iterator to the corresponding coordinate iterator;
00043   // generic version for points whose coordinate containers have begin()
00044   template < typename Pit_, typename Cit_ >
00045   struct CoordAccessor {
00046     typedef Pit_                                  Pit;
00047     typedef Cit_                                  Cit;
00048     inline  Cit operator() (Pit it) const { return (*it).begin(); }
00049   };
00050 
00051   // partial specialization for points whose coordinate containers are arrays
00052   template < typename Pit_, typename Cit_ >
00053   struct CoordAccessor<Pit_, Cit_*> {
00054     typedef Pit_                                  Pit;      
00055     typedef Cit_*                                 Cit;
00056     inline  Cit operator() (Pit it) const { return *it; }
00057   };
00058 
00059   // Class Declaration
00060   // =================
00061 
00062   template <typename CoordAccessor>
00063   class Miniball {
00064   private:
00065     // types
00066     // The iterator type to go through the input points
00067     typedef typename CoordAccessor::Pit                         Pit; 
00068     // The iterator type to go through the coordinates of a single point. 
00069     typedef typename CoordAccessor::Cit                         Cit; 
00070     // The coordinate type
00071     typedef typename std::iterator_traits<Cit>::value_type      NT;  
00072     // The iterator to go through the support points
00073     typedef typename std::list<Pit>::iterator                   Sit;
00074 
00075     // data members...
00076     const int d; // dimension
00077     Pit points_begin;        
00078     Pit points_end;          
00079     CoordAccessor coord_accessor;  
00080     double time;  
00081     const NT nt0; // NT(0)                         
00082 
00083     //...for the algorithms
00084     std::list<Pit> L;                       
00085     Sit support_end;                        
00086     int fsize;   // number of forced points                                   
00087     int ssize;   // number of support points                               
00088 
00089     // ...for the ball updates
00090     NT* current_c;                         
00091     NT  current_sqr_r;                      
00092     NT** c;                                    
00093     NT* sqr_r;                    
00094  
00095     // helper arrays
00096     NT* q0;
00097     NT* z;
00098     NT* f;
00099     NT** v;
00100     NT** a;
00101 
00102   public:
00103     // The iterator type to go through the support points
00104     typedef typename std::list<Pit>::const_iterator SupportPointIterator;
00105   
00106     // PRE:  [begin, end) is a nonempty range
00107     // POST: computes the smallest enclosing ball of the points in the range
00108     //       [begin, end); the functor a maps a point iterator to an iterator 
00109     //       through the d coordinates of the point  
00110     Miniball (int d_, Pit begin, Pit end, CoordAccessor ca = CoordAccessor());
00111 
00112     // POST: returns a pointer to the first element of an array that holds
00113     //       the d coordinates of the center of the computed ball  
00114     const NT* center () const;
00115 
00116     // POST: returns the squared radius of the computed ball  
00117     NT squared_radius () const;
00118  
00119     // POST: returns the number of support points of the computed ball;
00120     //       the support points form a minimal set with the same smallest
00121     //       enclosing ball as the input set; in particular, the support
00122     //       points are on the boundary of the computed ball, and their
00123     //       number is at most d+1 
00124     int nr_support_points () const;
00125  
00126     // POST: returns an iterator to the first support point 
00127     SupportPointIterator support_points_begin () const;
00128 
00129     // POST: returns a past-the-end iterator for the range of support points  
00130     SupportPointIterator support_points_end () const;
00131 
00132     // POST: returns the maximum excess of any input point w.r.t. the computed 
00133     //       ball, divided by the squared radius of the computed ball. The 
00134     //       excess of a point is the difference between its squared distance
00135     //       from the center and the squared radius; Ideally, the return value 
00136     //       is 0. subopt is set to the absolute value of the most negative 
00137     //       coefficient in the affine combination of the support points that 
00138     //       yields the center. Ideally, this is a convex combination, and there 
00139     //       is no negative coefficient in which case subopt is set to 0.  
00140     NT relative_error (NT& subopt) const;
00141   
00142     // POST: return true if the relative error is at most tol, and the
00143     //       suboptimality is 0; the default tolerance is 10 times the
00144     //       coordinate type's machine epsilon  
00145     bool is_valid (NT tol = NT(10) * std::numeric_limits<NT>::epsilon()) const;
00146 
00147     // POST: returns the time in seconds taken by the constructor call for 
00148     //       computing the smallest enclosing ball  
00149     double get_time() const;
00150 
00151     // POST: deletes dynamically allocated arrays
00152     ~Miniball();
00153 
00154   private:  
00155     void mtf_mb (Sit n);
00156     void mtf_move_to_front (Sit j);
00157     void pivot_mb (Pit n);
00158     void pivot_move_to_front (Pit j);
00159     NT excess (Pit pit) const;
00160     void pop ();
00161     bool push (Pit pit);
00162     NT suboptimality () const;
00163     void create_arrays();
00164     void delete_arrays();
00165   };
00166 
00167   // Class Definition
00168   // ================
00169   template <typename CoordAccessor>
00170   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::Miniball (int d_, Pit begin, Pit end, 
00171                                      CoordAccessor ca) 
00172     : d (d_), 
00173       points_begin (begin), 
00174       points_end (end), 
00175       coord_accessor (ca), 
00176       time (clock()), 
00177       nt0 (NT(0)), 
00178       L(), 
00179       support_end (L.begin()), 
00180       fsize(0), 
00181       ssize(0), 
00182       current_c (NULL), 
00183       current_sqr_r (NT(-1)),
00184       c (NULL),
00185       sqr_r (NULL),
00186       q0 (NULL),
00187       z (NULL),
00188       f (NULL),
00189       v (NULL),
00190       a (NULL)
00191   {     
00192     assert (points_begin != points_end);
00193     create_arrays();
00194 
00195     // set initial center
00196     for (int j=0; j<d; ++j) c[0][j] = nt0;
00197     current_c = c[0];
00198 
00199     // compute miniball
00200     pivot_mb (points_end);
00201 
00202     // update time
00203     time = (clock() - time) / CLOCKS_PER_SEC;
00204   }
00205   
00206   template <typename CoordAccessor>
00207   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::~Miniball()
00208   {
00209     delete_arrays();
00210   }
00211 
00212   template <typename CoordAccessor>
00213   void Miniball<CoordAccessor>::create_arrays() 
00214   {
00215     c = new NT*[d+1]; 
00216     v = new NT*[d+1]; 
00217     a = new NT*[d+1];
00218     for (int i=0; i<d+1; ++i) {
00219       c[i] = new NT[d];
00220       v[i] = new NT[d];
00221       a[i] = new NT[d];
00222     }
00223     sqr_r = new NT[d+1];
00224     q0 = new NT[d];
00225     z = new NT[d+1];
00226     f = new NT[d+1];
00227   } 
00228 
00229   template <typename CoordAccessor>
00230   void Miniball<CoordAccessor>::delete_arrays() 
00231   {
00232     delete[] f;
00233     delete[] z;
00234     delete[] q0;
00235     delete[] sqr_r;
00236     for (int i=0; i<d+1; ++i) {
00237       delete[] a[i];
00238       delete[] v[i];
00239       delete[] c[i];
00240     }
00241     delete[] a;
00242     delete[] v;
00243     delete[] c;
00244   }
00245 
00246   template <typename CoordAccessor>
00247   const typename Miniball<CoordAccessor>::NT* 
00248   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::center () const 
00249   {
00250     return current_c;
00251   }

00253   template <typename CoordAccessor>
00254   typename Miniball<CoordAccessor>::NT 
00255   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::squared_radius () const 
00256   {
00257     return current_sqr_r;
00258   }
00259 
00260   template <typename CoordAccessor>
00261   int Miniball<CoordAccessor>::nr_support_points () const 
00262   {
00263     assert (ssize < d+2);
00264     return ssize;
00265   }

00267   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00268   typename Miniball<CoordAccessor>::SupportPointIterator 
00269   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::support_points_begin () const 
00270   {
00271     return L.begin();
00272   }
00273 
00274   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00275   typename Miniball<CoordAccessor>::SupportPointIterator 
00276   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::support_points_end () const  
00277   {
00278     return support_end;
00279   }
00280 
00281   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00282   typename Miniball<CoordAccessor>::NT 
00283   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::relative_error (NT& subopt) const 
00284   {
00285     NT e, max_e = nt0;
00286     // compute maximum absolute excess of support points
00287     for (SupportPointIterator it = support_points_begin(); 
00288          it != support_points_end(); ++it) {
00289       e = excess (*it);
00290       if (e < nt0) e = -e;
00291       if (e > max_e) {
00292         max_e = e; 
00293       }
00294     }
00295     // compute maximum excess of any point
00296     for (Pit i = points_begin; i != points_end; ++i)
00297       if ((e = excess (i)) > max_e)
00298         max_e = e;
00299    
00300     subopt = suboptimality();
00301     assert (current_sqr_r > nt0 || max_e == nt0);
00302     return (current_sqr_r == nt0 ? nt0 : max_e / current_sqr_r);
00303   }
00304 
00305   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00306   bool Miniball<CoordAccessor>::is_valid (NT tol) const
00307   {
00308     NT suboptimality;
00309     return ( (relative_error (suboptimality) <= tol) && (suboptimality == 0) );
00310   }
00311 
00312   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00313   double Miniball<CoordAccessor>::get_time() const 
00314   {
00315     return time;
00316   }
00317 
00318   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00319   void Miniball<CoordAccessor>::mtf_mb (Sit n)
00320   {
00321     // Algorithm 1: mtf_mb (L_{n-1}, B), where L_{n-1} = [L.begin, n)  
00322     // B: the set of forced points, defining the current ball
00323     // S: the superset of support points computed by the algorithm
00324     // --------------------------------------------------------------
00325     // from B. Gaertner, Fast and Robust Smallest Enclosing Balls, ESA 1999,
00326     // http://www.inf.ethz.ch/personal/gaertner/texts/own_work/esa99_final.pdf  
00327   
00328     //   PRE: B = S  
00329     assert (fsize == ssize);
00330    
00331     support_end = L.begin();
00332     if ((fsize) == d+1) return;  
00333   
00334     // incremental construction
00335     for (Sit i = L.begin(); i != n;) 
00336       {
00337         // INV: (support_end - L.begin() == |S|-|B|)
00338         assert (std::distance (L.begin(), support_end) == ssize - fsize);
00339        
00340         Sit j = i++; 
00341         if (excess(*j) > nt0) 
00342           if (push(*j)) {          // B := B + p_i
00343             mtf_mb (j);            // mtf_mb (L_{i-1}, B + p_i)
00344             pop();                 // B := B - p_i
00345             mtf_move_to_front(j);  
00346           }
00347       }
00348     // POST: the range [L.begin(), support_end) stores the set S\B
00349   }
00350 
00351   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00352   void Miniball<CoordAccessor>::mtf_move_to_front (Sit j) 
00353   {
00354     if (support_end == j)
00355       support_end++;
00356     L.splice (L.begin(), L, j);
00357   }
00358 
00359   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00360   void Miniball<CoordAccessor>::pivot_mb (Pit n) 
00361   {
00362     // Algorithm 2: pivot_mb (L_{n-1}), where L_{n-1} = [L.begin, n)  
00363     // --------------------------------------------------------------
00364     // from B. Gaertner, Fast and Robust Smallest Enclosing Balls, ESA 1999,
00365     // http://www.inf.ethz.ch/personal/gaertner/texts/own_work/esa99_final.pdf  
00366     NT          old_sqr_r;
00367     const NT*   c;
00368     Pit         pivot, k;
00369     NT          e, max_e, sqr_r;
00370     Cit p;
00371     do {
00372       old_sqr_r = current_sqr_r;
00373       sqr_r = current_sqr_r;
00374 
00375       pivot = points_begin;
00376       max_e = nt0;
00377       for (k = points_begin; k != n; ++k) {
00378         p = coord_accessor(k);
00379         e = -sqr_r;
00380         c = current_c;
00381         for (int j=0; j<d; ++j)
00382           e += mb_sqr<NT>(*p++-*c++);
00383         if (e > max_e) {
00384           max_e = e;
00385           pivot = k;
00386         }
00387       }
00388 
00389       if (max_e > nt0) {
00390         // check if the pivot is already contained in the support set
00391         if (std::find(L.begin(), support_end, pivot) == support_end) {
00392           assert (fsize == 0);
00393           if (push (pivot)) {
00394             mtf_mb(support_end);
00395             pop();
00396             pivot_move_to_front(pivot);
00397           }
00398         }
00399       }
00400     } while (old_sqr_r < current_sqr_r);
00401   }
00402 
00403   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00404   void Miniball<CoordAccessor>::pivot_move_to_front (Pit j) 
00405   {
00406     L.push_front(j);
00407     if (std::distance(L.begin(), support_end) == d+2)
00408       support_end--;
00409   }
00410 
00411   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00412   inline typename Miniball<CoordAccessor>::NT 
00413   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::excess (Pit pit) const 
00414   {
00415     Cit p = coord_accessor(pit);
00416     NT e = -current_sqr_r;
00417     NT* c = current_c;
00418     for (int k=0; k<d; ++k){
00419       e += mb_sqr<NT>(*p++-*c++);
00420     }
00421     return e;
00422   }
00423 
00424   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00425   void Miniball<CoordAccessor>::pop ()  
00426   {
00427     --fsize;
00428   }
00429 
00430   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00431   bool Miniball<CoordAccessor>::push (Pit pit) 
00432   {
00433     int i, j;
00434     NT eps = mb_sqr<NT>(std::numeric_limits<NT>::epsilon());
00435    
00436     Cit cit = coord_accessor(pit);
00437     Cit p = cit;
00438  
00439     if (fsize==0) {
00440       for (i=0; i<d; ++i)
00441         q0[i] = *p++;
00442       for (i=0; i<d; ++i)
00443         c[0][i] = q0[i];
00444       sqr_r[0] = nt0;
00445     } 
00446     else {
00447       // set v_fsize to Q_fsize
00448       for (i=0; i<d; ++i)
00449         //v[fsize][i] = p[i]-q0[i];
00450         v[fsize][i] = *p++-q0[i];
00451       
00452       // compute the a_{fsize,i}, i< fsize
00453       for (i=1; i<fsize; ++i) {
00454         a[fsize][i] = nt0;
00455         for (j=0; j<d; ++j)
00456           a[fsize][i] += v[i][j] * v[fsize][j];
00457         a[fsize][i]*=(2/z[i]);
00458       }
00459       
00460       // update v_fsize to Q_fsize-\bar{Q}_fsize
00461       for (i=1; i<fsize; ++i) {
00462         for (j=0; j<d; ++j)
00463           v[fsize][j] -= a[fsize][i]*v[i][j];
00464       }
00465       
00466       // compute z_fsize
00467       z[fsize]=nt0;
00468       for (j=0; j<d; ++j)
00469         z[fsize] += mb_sqr<NT>(v[fsize][j]);
00470       z[fsize]*=2;
00471       
00472       // reject push if z_fsize too small
00473       if (z[fsize]<eps*current_sqr_r) {
00474         return false;
00475       }
00476       
00477       // update c, sqr_r
00478       p=cit;
00479       NT e = -sqr_r[fsize-1];
00480       for (i=0; i<d; ++i)
00481         e += mb_sqr<NT>(*p++-c[fsize-1][i]);
00482       f[fsize]=e/z[fsize];
00483       
00484       for (i=0; i<d; ++i)
00485         c[fsize][i] = c[fsize-1][i]+f[fsize]*v[fsize][i];
00486       sqr_r[fsize] = sqr_r[fsize-1] + e*f[fsize]/2;
00487     }
00488     current_c = c[fsize];
00489     current_sqr_r = sqr_r[fsize];
00490     ssize = ++fsize;
00491     return true;
00492   }
00493  
00494   template <typename CoordAccessor>  
00495   typename Miniball<CoordAccessor>::NT 
00496   Miniball<CoordAccessor>::suboptimality () const
00497   {
00498     NT* l = new NT[d+1];
00499     NT min_l = nt0;
00500     l[0] = NT(1);
00501     for (int i=ssize-1; i>0; --i) {
00502       l[i] = f[i];
00503       for (int k=ssize-1; k>i; --k)
00504         l[i]-=a[k][i]*l[k];
00505       if (l[i] < min_l) min_l = l[i];
00506       l[0] -= l[i];
00507     }
00508     if (l[0] < min_l) min_l = l[0];
00509     delete[] l;
00510     if (min_l < nt0)
00511       return -min_l;
00512     return nt0;
00513   }
